alert.note: Alert for Warren; Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 5:23PM EDT until August 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Warren and Washington. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitehall, Hague, Huletts Landing, Rogers Rock Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Eagle Point Campground, Putnam, Wright, Sabbath Day Point, Silver Bay, Graphite, Indian Kettles, Clemons, Dresden Center, North Bolton, Shelving Rock, Glenburnie, Ottenburgs Ramp, Snody Dock and Putnam Station. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
